places_with_reviews.name: THE GAURIKUND HOTEL

reviews.text:
Me & my family just have lunch in this HPTDC rest house and we are touched by their hospitality. They offered us gr8 food, inquire us why we haven't stay with them and also request us to stay next time with them. Our driver stays there and he confirm it is way better than any private guest house of bharmour.
The next mention is the view from Gaurikund's helipad, breathtaking. We will never know this if we do not go there to have our lunch. Be aware of hygiene in all bharmore, this place looks most hygienic to eat.
Very good location to stay with excellent views of mani mahesh.

My stay at Hotel Gaurikund exceeded all expectations. It was a seamless blend of beauty, comfort, and exceptional service. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking an unforgettable experience, be it for spiritual or religious.

It's basic room not for someone expecting 5star service or luxury. Caretaker managed property. At an amazing location. Though reaching here is bit tough and to-fro travel if with own car is impossible as the road leading to hotel is two way and very steep and narrow something that only locals can handle.

It's position is awesome.The hotel is located at the top of the hill just beside the helipad with 360° view of snow capped mountains. Sunrise can be seen from all the rooms.Each room has an attached bathroom fitted with all modern fittings. All types of food is available in their canteen but has to be ordered before-hand.During the Yatra from Janmastami to Radhastami helicopter service is available from the front of the hotel for visiting Manimahesh.Sureshji the caretaker is a very nice person. It is a must visit.

places_with_reviews.name: HOTEL BHARMOUR VIEW
address: Bharmani Chowk, 84 Road, Bharmour, Himachal Pradesh 176315, India

reviews.text:
Hotel are OK Ok

This is my first experience with this hotel but There are very less facilities as compare to other hotels.

And room services which they need to improve on you rest location are in good place

you can easily get cab for Bharmani Mata and Harsar directly at the door step……

Considering the location, it's a decent place to stay. Owner and staffs are very polite and helpful. Special mention for Mr. Vipin. He is just a call away. Has been very supportive during my 3 days stay in this property.
Hope to meet soon.
Thank you!
Room is good. Location is also perfect

Very good place to stay. Location is excellent, just walking distance from chaurasi temple. Staff is very cooperative. Mr Vipin  from hotel staff was very helpful and polite. Very good management. A 10 star from our side.

Excellent service. Rooms and other amenities where upto the mark...the host/manager Vipin is every helpful and enthusiastic and ready to help at all hours.

Lovely place...will definitely visit again.

I was stationed in this hotel for about 15-20 days. Firstly I would like to say that my stay at Bharmour View was comfortable. Since this place is located in the interiors, there may be power cuts or water issues that you may encounter in every other hotel you go in for. However Hotel Bharmour View has enough supply of water (they have 4-5 big syntex tankies) and a backup supply that can last for a few hours.
My room had a nice bed, tv,water heater, clean western toilet with jet spray.The rooms with the front view should be highly sought for(you will rise up to a beautiful view of snow mountains depending upon the cloud situations).
The staff includes Vipin who takes care of all your room service requirements and is extremely well behaved 21 year old boy with a great sense of responsibility towards your instructions.Dr.Atul is the hotel owner who is trying his best to cater to your needs and is very welcoming and hospitable towards the guests. People in this small town are extremely friendly and caring. Please do try the local vaishno dhaba a few meters away from the hotel(didn't run into stomach problems). You shall find a few confectioneries that serve basic omelette bread and nice tea. The Chaurasi Mandir nearby was built in the 7th century and has a warm vibe to it. People who are visiting Dalhousie and Chamba should definitely go to bharmour for finding peace and tranquility.

places_with_reviews.name: Bharmour Home Stay
address: Main Road, Bharmour, R.F.Moru, Himachal Pradesh 176315, India

reviews.text:
Bharmour, also known as Machu Pichu of Himachal, formally known as Brahmpura, was the ancient capital of Chamba district in Himachal Pradesh, India. Situated at an altitude of 2,100 metres in the Budhil valley, forty miles to the south-east of Chamba, Bharmour is known for its scenic beauty and for its ancient temples. Some of the temples are believed to date from 10th century.

As the whole country around Bharmour is supposed to belong to lord Shiva, it is popularly spoken of as Shiva Bhumi, "abode of lord Shiva". It lies between the Pir-Panjal and Dhauladhar range, between Ravi and Chenab valley. The land is blessed with deep beauty of abundant alpine pastures and provides home for nomadic shepherds, known as Gaddis, thus also called Gadderan. The foothills are filled with orchards and terraced farmsteads. The epitome of spirituality lies in this land as it is endowed with ancient temples. The area goes through inhospitable terrain and severe climate changes. "Kailash Vasio" as the people of Bharmour are known are extremely courteous and welcomes visitors like their own family members. Along with its ethnic traditions, culture and ancient history, Bharmour forms the perfection of divine splendour.
It so lovely place so peaceful and calm greenery every where...really so Lovely place.. actually best place for trip. Nice scenery.

We changed our stay to Hotel Chaurasi, which is decent among all hotels there. This hotel is very near parking (just walking distance) and near to Chaurasi temple and local shopping market. Near there is Punjabi dhaba, food quality is good. Bhamour home stay and Hotel Chaurasi both have beautiful views and chill winds. So enjoyed our stay a lot. Night view and sunrise 🌅 is awsome

Its a 4 star place nice place to stay. Whenever you visit chamba go and find bharmour valley its sittuated on the bank of the ravi river. People are so nice and rich in culture. There outfit attract people. Mostly gaddi people live there.
A must visit place.
Awesome place, excellent food and services 👌

places_with_reviews.name: Manimahesh Hotel Bharmour
address: Village Patty Post Office, Thesil, Bharmour, Himachal Pradesh 176315, India

reviews.text:
Reasonable to the pocket. Very near by to bus stop. You can reach Hadsar with Rs 30/- . Which is a point from where you get horses and you can walk to Manimahesh track.
Only rooms are available. It's run by a family. They are very friendly. The staff is also very friendly. Food is available nearby.

Very good place to stay. Great view if you take the mountain view. Room was big and comfortable. No food but there is Patyal restaurant nearby which is excellent and also delivers. Overall a good experience to stay here.
Rooms are ok , service is not good, location is nice.

Have stayed here multiple times in 2019 and 2022. The rooms are clean and bright, all with excellent north-east views of the Bharmour valley. The owner and all staff are very friendly and accommodating. I'm particularly pleased  that the quality of the amenities has been consistently high over the years.
The location is especially peaceful as there is less traffic and honking in this part of town. It doesn't feel as crowded as the main Chaurasi area, but you can walk to the mandir complex in 10 minutes via a shortcut through the village (lots of uphill walking!). There are plenty of small stores and restaurants nearby. My favorite is Thakur Dhaba, about a 2 minute walk towards the bus stand.

Good Hotel with Great view and Location.
Staff and owner is very friendly.

places_with_reviews.name: Bharmour villa,Home stay

reviews.text:
Travel date : Mar '23

Pros:
- Excellent view, you will get a 360 view of mountains. We were surrounded by snow peaked mountains as well.
- Very good service by Susil, the caretaker.
- Food is homely and quite cheap.
- Fully aloof, you won't have other properties near your side.
- The market is available at a distance of 300-400 meters.
- Various trek options are available from this place.

Cons:
- We found some spiders , centipede, caterpillars and even rats in our rooms.
- Roads leading to this place are quite difficult and hectic, so beware of that.

We took a cab from Bir, which included two stops for roaming around, and two stops for food, and it took us around 12 hours in total. So plan your travel accordingly.

We didn't get any snowfall in the month of March.

The place is amazing. Fantastic view and the bedroom all in wood. The owner is very nice and took me around the city. Only the food was a bit disappointing and late but I'm sure it will be resolved soon. Highly recommended
Location good. Service very very very poor. No backup for electricity.  Daily goods not available nearby.  Even for morning tea u have too wait for milk

Himachali guide is the most convenient and helpful guide services. With finding the best local food, experiencing local villages to the best view points, they provide you the best.
Locations are amazing and you get the best vibe and view from your window!
Visiting himachal is even better if you get it done with himachali guide! 🤍

A place which is aloof from the surroundings..it will be like you are living in heaven..but now they have closed the home stay..the owners are gem,sweet persons. Hope they start again their home stay as i feel demand will be great. A small tree house is also there where you can simply sit and enjoy reading a book. Overall a must stay place if they start again.

address: Chourasi Road, Distt, Bharmour, Himachal Pradesh 176315, India

reviews.text: Budget hotel. Polite and cordial behaviour of staff. Nice view from the balcony. A shot from balcony after sunset is depicted

Maybe it is one of the nicer places in Bharmour, and the staff are supportive, but our room was missing 2 windows (it is cold in late December!) and was certainly not cleaned for at least good few months..

Sanjay the person working there is a one man army, really took care of us. Really appreciate the service provided except for the fact that some rooms are really really awful with no water facilities and some missing windows, which does freeze a person to death in the winters.Had to take one of their blankets and go DIY to protect myself from the cold.
Nice service, owner is very polite and helping .... and fabulous view from hotel balcony ... I am sharing the click as well ...
This place is moderately good to stay..view is good room the window bt very congested.
